instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01598 No backlight
threads.message: Any thoughts on where to start with a backlight issue on this board that had a very minimal spill? I can't find any sign of the spill or any physical damage on the board. There is video but no backlight. Works on external monitor. Keyboard, trackpad, everything else works fine. I tested it with my known-good 2019 test screen. No change. Not sure where to start with this.

threads.title: 820-01598 No backlight
threads.message: I'm using the 820-01598 schematic. This had a tiny bit of corrosion to the right of L8410. Other than that, it was really clean.

threads.title: 820-01598 No backlight
threads.message: Is there a way to DM you?

threads.title: 820-01598 No backlight
threads.message:
Upload the schematic somewhere.
You can send link through PM...

threads.title: 820-01598 No backlight
threads.message: I can't figure out how to do a pm with the new forum. I only see Start Conversation, which seems to be public

threads.title: 820-01598 No backlight
threads.message: Send me a pm if you can and I'll respond

threads.title: 820-01598 No backlight
threads.message:
Is true, I don't see any option for PM.
Write to [email]2informaticos@gmail.com[/email] directly.

threads.title: 820-01598 No backlight
threads.message:
Start checking diode mode to ground at both pins of D8410.
Also post its voltages.
Be sure F8400 is good.

EDP_BKLT_EN goes high?

threads.title: 820-01598 No backlight
threads.message:
Everything seems normal. F8400 is good. EDP_BKLT_EN is at 3.3V
D8410 measurements are good.
1) 1.116
2) .800

threads.title: 820-01598 No backlight
threads.message:
R8442 is good?
Do you get 0V at BKLT_SD?
Post voltage and diode mode to BKLT_SCL/SDA lines.
Be sure all R8450-53 are good.

threads.title: 820-01598 No backlight
threads.message: Solved. You got me there with BKLT_SD. Blown trace right above R8402. Pin 2 had no connection. Working great now. Thanks for the help.
